news_header: US stock markets rose after the election, with Nasdaq up 1.4%, S&P 500 up 1.2%, and Dow Jones up 1.0%.
news_text: On Tuesday, following the recent election, US stock markets experienced gains. The Nasdaq, which focuses on technology, increased by 1.4%, while the S&P 500 rose by 1.2%. The Dow Jones, which represents industrial companies, saw a 1.0% increase. On the same day, the US was set to vote for the next president, with Kamala Harris and Donald Trump in a competitive race.
